content.title: ICAR - Post Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Caste / Scheduled Tribes Candidates
content.department: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
content.details: The scheme 'Post-Matric Scholarship to Scheduled Castes / Scheduled Tribes Candidates' was introduced by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR), Department of Agricultural Research and Education (DARE), to enable the students belonging to the weaker sections of society to complete undergraduate courses. The scholarship is provided for studying at the Bachelor's Degree program in various branches of Agriculture viz. B.Sc.(Agri.), B.V.Sc., B.Sc.(Agril. Engg.), B.Sc.(Home Science), B.F.Sc., B.Sc.(Forestry) etc. The value of the scholarship will be ₹ 1,000/- per month along with a contingent grant of ₹ 750/- per annum for the payment of tuition fees, purchase of books, cost of uniforms, etc. The duration of the scholarship will cover the whole of the normal period of the particular degree program to which the candidate is admitted.
benefits: The value of the scholarship will be ₹ 1,000/- per month.
A contingent grant of ₹ 750/- per annum for the payment of tuition fees, purchase of books, cost of uniforms, etc.
The duration of the scholarship will cover the whole of the normal period of the particular degree program.
eligibility: This scholarship is exclusively meant for students belonging to Scheduled Castes / Scheduled Tribes communities as defined by the Government of India.
Only those students who have been admitted to Agricultural Universities in any of the undergraduate degrees programmes of Agriculture & Allied Sciences will be eligible for this scholarship.
content.application_process: The scholarship amount as well as the contingent grant will be remitted to the respective institutions by the Council on the basis of the demand received from each institution through the Registrar / Comptroller of the University in the prescribed proforma. The students will be eligible to receive scholarships and contingent grants from the date of joining the course.
documents_required: Details of the Aadhaar Linked Bank Account
Marksheets of the Previous Qualified Examination

faqs.question: Do I have to fill up the online application in one sitting?
faqs.answer: No. You can fill up the online application in many sittings using ‘Save Draft’, until you are satisfied that you have entered all desirable fields correctly.

faqs.question: What is the Eligibility Criteria for this scholarship?
faqs.answer: This scholarship is exclusively meant for students belonging to Scheduled Castes / Scheduled Tribes communities as defined by Government of India.

faqs.question: What is the Value Of The Scholarship?
faqs.answer: The value of the scholarship will be ₹ 1,000/- per month along with a contingent grant of ₹ 750/- per annum.

faqs.question: What Is The Duration Of The Scholarship?
faqs.answer: The duration of the scholarship will cover the whole of the normal period of the particular degree programme to which the candidate is admitted.

faqs.question: What is the Procedure for Selection?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides for the award of 240 scholarships every year, earmarked for individual Agricultural Universities in proportion to the actual number of scheduled castes / scheduled tribes candidates admitted.

faqs.question: Will the Student Who Accepts This Scholarship Be Permitted To Avail Of Any Other Scholarship/Concession?
faqs.answer: The student who accepts this scholarship will not be permitted to avail of any other scholarship/concession provided by any other agencies nor permitted to accept any part-time employment.

faqs.question: Under what cases can the Scholarship of the student be Terminated?
faqs.answer: The scholarship will be terminated without notice if the scholar debases to be on the roll of the institution or is found to be negligent in his/her studies or guilty of misconduct.

faqs.question: Will the Scholarship Be Admissible On Grounds Of Maternity?
faqs.answer: In the case of married women, the scholarship will be admissible at full rates up to three months' absence on grounds of maternity.

faqs.question: Which branches of Agriculture of the Bachelor's Degree Program are covered in this scheme?
faqs.answer: Bachelor's Degree program in various branches of Agriculture, viz. B.Sc.(Agri.), B.V.Sc., B.Sc.(Agril. Engg.), B.Sc.(Home Science), B.F.Sc., B.Sc.(Forestry) etc.

faqs.question: How many scholarships are awarded every year?
faqs.answer: The scheme provides for the award of 240 scholarships every year.

faqs.question: Is there any earmarking of the scholarships?
faqs.answer: These scholarships will be earmarked for individual Agricultural Universities in proportion to the actual number of scheduled castes / scheduled tribes candidates admitted.
